thread.title: Eriksen gives Tottenham draw at Swansea in Premier League
thread.title_full: Eriksen gives Tottenham draw at Swansea in Premier League | Boston Herald

author: Associated Press
title: Eriksen gives Tottenham draw at Swansea in Premier League
text:
SWANSEA, Wales — Tottenham striker Harry Kane scored at the wrong end in his team's 2-2 draw at Swansea in the Premier League on Sunday but Christian Eriksen saved a point for the visitors with two brilliant free kicks.
Chasing a fourth straight league win for the first time since January 2014, Tottenham dominated for long periods at Liberty Stadium but could not take its chances in open play.
Twice Spurs had to come from behind after Andre Ayew's header in the 16th and then a mistake by Kane had given Swansea the lead.
Kane has only scored once for Spurs this season — in last week's 4-1 victory over league leader Manchester City — but the England striker found his own net when he miscued Jonjo Shelvey's corner after 31 minutes.
Spurs started on the front foot as Swansea struggled to cope with high pressing tactics, and the hosts had hardly broken out of their own half when they launched a length-of-the-field move which ended with their first goal in open play for more than 300 minutes.
Lukasz Fabianski started in his own area and Federico Fernandez, Angel Rangel, Bafetimbi Gomis and Gylfi Sigurdsson were all involved before Jefferson Montero crossed for Ayew to head home his fourth Swansea goal.
Spurs responded by Nacer Chadli forcing a good save from Fabianski at his near post but the Poland goalkeeper had no answer to Eriksen's 27th-minute free kick which went over the wall and left him badly wrong-footed.
Eriksen almost gave Spurs the lead moments later but the visitors were stunned when Kane put the ball into his own net to make it 2-1.
After Shelvey pushed Dele Alli over on the edge of the box, Eriksen sent the free kick into the top corner in the 65th to secure the draw.
Tottenham is eighth with 13 points, three more than Swansea, after eight games.
